definition[0]: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly
example[0]: The paper was highly commended in the UK Press Awards.
example[1]: Inspector Marshall was commended for his professional attitude.
definition[1]: to tell someone that something is good or that it deserves attention
example[2]: Colleagues, I commend this report to you.
example[3]: McKellenâ€™s performance had much to commend it  (=was very good).
